result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Adam C. Thayer in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 15 CM 184, 16 CF 86, 15 CM 249, 15 CF 191, 16 CF 163, 14 CM 451, and 16 CF80.  11:37 AM  Court calls cases and recites appearances.  Atty McL waived preliminary exam 16 CF 86 and 16 CF 163.  Court finds DE has freely waived his right to preliminary exam.  Atty McL acknowledged receipt of information and waived formal reading.
State recites plea agreement: 15 CF 191 - count 1 amended to straight burglary 943.10(1)(a) -  10 years prison / 4 yrs incarcerated and 6 yrs ES 96 days credit time served - costs - restitution jt/several with Rodney Papish and David Gourley  restitution to Kathy Ditmer - with earned release and challenge
16 CF 86 - NC to count 1 count 2 DRI - 6 years - 3 yrs in and 3 yrs ES imposed/Stayed ( pending completion of ES in 15 CF 191) - Costs 
16 CF 163 - NC to count 3 and count 4 / counts 1,2 and 5 thru 8 DRI - Sentence w/held probation 5 years consecutive in 15 CF 191 - costs
15 CM 249 - 15 CM 184 - 14 CM 451 and 16 CF 80 DRI
Court grants amendment to 15 CF 191 to burglary 943.10(1)(a).  DE entered plea of NC to 15 CF 91 / 16 CF 86 count 1 / 16 CF 163 counts 3 and 4.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court finds DE guilty.  Ms. Ditmer addressed the Court. Atty McL waived PSI and State waived PSI.  Terry Tainter addressed the Court.
COURT:
15 CF 191:  10 years prison / 4 yrs incarcerated and 6 yrs ES 96 days credit time served - costs $518.00  - restitution jt/several with Rodney Papish and David Gourley $9515.02  restitution to Kathy Ditmer - with earned release and challenge /15 CM 249, 15 CM 184, 14 CM 451 and 16 CF 80 DRI

16 CF 86 count 1:  6 years - 3 yrs in and 3 yrs ES imposed/Stayed ( pending completion of sentence in 15 CF 191) - Costs $518.00 /Count 2 is dismissed and read-in 15 CM 249, 15 CM 184, 14 CM 451 and 16 CF 80 DRI

16 CF 163 counts 3 and 4:  Sentence w/held probation 5 years consecutive in 15 CF 191 - costs $518.00  / counts 1, 2, 5, 6, 7 and 8 are dismissed and read-in 15 CM 249, 15 CM 184, 14 CM 451 and 16 CF 80 DRI

Defendant Adam Charles Thayer in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Defendant Adam Charles Thayer in custody, appeared by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Bond Continues.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 11, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Adam C. Thayer in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Defendant Adam C. Thayer in custody appeared by video.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Bond Continues  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Warrant Card

Combined with L-16-0683, 14 CM 451, 15 CM 184, 15 CF 191, 15 CM 249,16 CF 80 and 16 CF 86. No contact with Robert Barber, Kathy Dittmer or Stan Dittmer. This applies to all cases.  No abusive Contact with  -
	 Gina Price
	Statutory Minimum Domestic Abuse Bail Conditions
	As a condition of my release from custody in this matter, I agree that I will not engage in any threats or acts of domestic abuse against the victim "Gina Price" or any other person.
	I understand that "domestic abuse" means:
	Intentional infliction of physical pain, injury or illness.
	Intentional impairment of physical condition. 
	First, second or third degree sexual assault.  
	A physical act that may cause the other person reason to fear imminent engagement in the conduct described above, including but not limited to the intentional destruction of physical property.

Defendant Adam Charles Thayer in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Larimore is allowed to w/draw as counsel as there is a conflict.  Bail continues.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Received a call from Atty. Loso.  He is not the attorney - should be Joel Larimore for 3 cases.

Case called.
Defendant Adam C. Thayer in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Jarvis: DEF was in need of a new attorney as Atty Gramstrup asked to be removed 10/27/15. Internal diffuculties at PD office. Atty Jarvis will stay on as atty. Requests a s/c.

11:44 DEF is now here. His bond shows he was to be here at 11:45.
Court: Warrant quashed as DEF is on time. Will set for another plea(s). Told DEF to get in contact with his atty to go over plea letter.
Court orders Clerks office to send notice to Atty Gramstrup.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Case called. Defendant Adam Charles Thayer in court.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Working on plea agreement. 
Court speaks to conflict in 2 of DEF's current cases. Parties given option to wait on recusal until next court date. Parties concur. Adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 11:00 am.
